title: ACID properties
html:
ACID Properties in DBMS

  • Atomicity: A transaction is fully completed or not executed at all.
    Example: If a money transfer fails halfway, the database rolls back to the previous state using ROLLBACK and COMMIT.
  • Consistency: Database remains in a valid state before and after a transaction.
    Example: A bank account balance should never be negative. Transactions ensure this integrity.
  • Isolation: Transactions execute independently without interference.
    Example: Multiple transactions withdrawing money from the same account should not affect each other's operations.
  • Durability: Committed transactions remain permanently stored.
    Example: Data is saved to a hard disk or replicated to multiple servers to survive power failures.
